Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to work on being more confident in their decisions, particularly at work.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been trying to be more social and attended a gathering, feeling shy but making progress. They have also managed their temper better during a disagreement with their sister.
Current Functional Status: The patient feels relaxed when discussing common interests and is developing coping strategies to handle emotions better.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making strides in social interactions and emotional regulation, indicating positive development.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is practicing self-acceptance and is encouraged to speak up in meetings to build confidence.
Next Steps: The patient plans to share an idea in their next meeting and will discuss the outcome in the following session.
